title: dnata Travel takes you to the Rio 2016 OlympicsTravelandtourworld.com
text:
dnata Travel takes you to the Rio 2016 Olympics
The countdown has begun, and dnata Travel is ready to take sports fans across the UAE to experience the Olympic spirit first hand. dnata Travel has been appointed the Authorised Ticket Reseller (ATR) for the Rio 2016 Olympics by the UAE National Olympic Committee.
Next year, millions of people will travel to watch the Games as top athletes from around the globe compete for their countries during the Rio 2016 Olympics. dnata Travel, one of the Middle East’s leading travel providers will take fans from the UAE to Brazil for the event.
“We’re very pleased to select dnata Travel once again for the Rio 2016 Olympics as our ATR. They have a proven track record and most importantly the respect from the entire community as a high quality service provider. Our positive experience with dnata Travel from the London 2012 Olympics played a key role in continuing our relationship and we’re confident that many residents and locals from the UAE will be cheering on our team after booking through dnata, said Mr Abdulrahman Falaknaz, Marketing Committee Chairman and Board Member UAE National Olympic Committee.
dnata Travel has a variety of options available, from single event tickets to tailor-made travel packages. With event ticket prices starting from AED 75 per ticket (includes service fees), fans of every budget can take part in the excitement. Complete packages include flights, hotel accommodation, event tickets, and transfers.
“dnata Travel has considerable experience taking sports fans to the action, wherever it may be,” said Ailsa Pollard, Senior Vice President, dnata Travel. “The appointment by the UAE National Olympic Committee for the second time is a great vote of confidence in our capability and high level of service.”
“From rugby to football, and the spectacle of the Olympic games, our customers and partners know they can trust dnata to deliver an unforgettable experience,” added Pollard. “We will work with our range of partners to ensure travellers leave Rio with more than just photos, but a lifetime of memories.”
